articles.original_title: Lakers Injury Update: Luka Doncic Ruled Out Vs. 76ers
articles.summary: The Los Angeles Lakers announced that superstar Luka Doncic has been ruled out of Thursday night’s game against the Philadelphia 76ers with left leg soreness. Doncic played 16 minutes in the first half, scoring 10 points with four rebounds, two assists and five turnovers on 3-of-10 shooting. He limped back to the locker room towards […]

articles.summary: The trade deadline came and went for the Lakers with just a single trade executed: Gabe Vincent and a second round pick in exchange for Hawks sharpshooting veteran Luke Kennard. The Lakers were rumored to be continuing to look at additional moves on the margins after agreeing to send out Vincent, but nothing came to […]

articles.title: Meet the man behind the Super Bowl's annual confetti blizzard
articles.original_title: Meet the man behind the Super Bowl's annual confetti blizzard
articles.summary: Noah Winter brags he's been to way more Super Bowls than Tom Brady.  Winter's company, Artistry in Motion, also makes confetti for rock concerts, movies, political conventions and the Olympics.  Jane Gershovich, a photographer who worked for the Seattle Seahawks when they won the Super Bowl in 2014, said that when the confetti falls, everyone wants to play in it.

articles.title: Hornets beat Rockets 109-99 for eighth straight win
articles.original_title: Hornets beat Rockets 109-99 for eighth straight win
articles.summary: Rookie Kon Knueppel had 24 points and LaMelo Ball added 20 to help the Charlotte Hornets roll to a 109-99 victory over the Houston Rockets on Thursday night and extend their winning streak to eight games.  Charlotte’s streak is the franchise’s longest since winning nine in a row in the 1998-99 season.  The Hornets led by 16 after three quarters and Brandon Miller scored the first five points of the fourth to extend the lead to 96-75 with about 11 minutes to go.

articles.title: Luka Doncic leaves the Lakers' game against the 76ers with left leg injury
articles.original_title: Luka Doncic leaves the Lakers' game against the 76ers with left leg injury
articles.summary: NBA scoring leader Luka Doncic has left the Los Angeles Lakers' game against Philadelphia on Thursday night with a left leg injury.  Doncic leads the NBA with 33.4 points per game in his first full season with the Lakers.

articles.title: Booker and Crump push No. 4 Texas over No, 5 LSU 77-64 as Longhorns run home win streak to 39
articles.original_title: Booker and Crump push No. 4 Texas over No, 5 LSU 77-64 as Longhorns run home win streak to 39
articles.summary: Madison Booker scored 18 points, Aaliyah Crump added 16 and No. 4 Texas used a big run at the start of the fourth quarter to pull away from No. 5 LSU for a 77-64 victory Thursday night.  Texas' Kyla Oldacre scored four points in the 10-0 Texas run.  Texas (22-2, 7-2 SEC) ran its home winning streak to 39 — tied with TCU for the longest active streak of its kind in the nation — with a victory that keeps the Longhorns within a game of first place in the Southeastern Conference.

articles.title: Timmons scores 23 for No. 21 Alabama women in 64-63 thriller over No. 13 Ole Miss
articles.original_title: Timmons scores 23 for No. 21 Alabama women in 64-63 thriller over No. 13 Ole Miss
articles.summary: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) — Jessica Timmons scored 23 points and grabbed seven rebounds, Karly Weathers added 14 points and six rebounds, and No. 21 Alabama took down No. 13 Ole Miss 64-63 on Thursday night.Timmons scored six straight points beginning with 2:31 remaining in regulation, and gave the Crimson Tide (20-4, 6-4 Southeastern Conference) a lead with 47 seconds on the clock.After Ole Miss retook the lead on two free throws, Diana Collins made a driving layup that secured the win with 18 seco

articles.title: Jaloni Cambridge scores 26 as No. 9 Ohio State women beat No. 24 Washington 70-60
articles.original_title: Jaloni Cambridge scores 26 as No. 9 Ohio State women beat No. 24 Washington 70-60
articles.summary: Jaloni Cambridge scored 26 points and No. 9 Ohio State held off a late run by No. 24 Washington to win 70-60 on Thursday for its 10th win in the last 11 games.  Buckeyes coach Kevin McGuff, who spent nine seasons at Xavier and two at Washington before taking over at Ohio State in 2013, won his 500th career game.  Cambridge, who went in averaging 22.5 points per game (No. 7 nationally) this season, went 12 of 21 from the field and had her fourth straight game with at least 25.

articles.title: Wembanyama scores 29 points as Spurs beat Mavs despite another 30-plus night from Cooper Flagg
articles.original_title: Wembanyama scores 29 points as Spurs beat Mavs despite another 30-plus night from Cooper Flagg
articles.summary: Victor Wembanyama had 29 points and 11 rebounds, and the San Antonio Spurs overcame rookie No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg's fourth consecutive 30-point game in a 135-123 victory over the Dallas Mavericks on Thursday night.  Flagg scored 32 points to extend his NBA record for consecutive games with at least 30 points by a teenager.  The 19-year-old joined Michael Jordan, Bernard King, Allen Iverson and Jalen Green as the only rookies to score at least 30 in four straight games since the NBA-ABA merger i

articles.title: Tilly, Thornton, combine for 36 as Ohio State rolls 82-62 past Maryland
articles.original_title: Tilly, Thornton, combine for 36 as Ohio State rolls 82-62 past Maryland
articles.summary: Christoph Tilly and Bruce Thornton combined for 36 points as Ohio State beat Maryland 82-62 on Thursday.  Tilly had 19 on 7-of-10 shooting for the Buckeyes (15-7 7-5 Big Ten).  Thornton shot 7 of 9 to finish with 17.
